The green highlighted tank below is clipped into other parts. That's the problem. If you remove the tank and place it to the bottom node and don't move it up this craft works.

Expanding upon what Anth12 has already explained.  I can't call this an example of any bug in the game.

The large fuel tank is directly attached to the bottom of the spark engine.  They're not attached to each other via the decoupler.  That's why things aren't separating here.

You've offset the large fuel tank from the spark engine so they look like they're not attached, but they still are.

This highlights something that I think can be very counter-intuitive about KSP.  Just because things look like they're attached visually, they might not be.  When you attach a part to another part, and then move/rotate the attached part away from the first, they might look separated.  But, they are not.

I rearranged things so they were attached "properly" and this craft behaves like you'd expect during decoupling.

I do want to add this.  This highlights just how much freedom KSP gives us in building our crafts.  And we frequently abuse it to get the looks and behavior we want.  But this can be very problematic if you don't have a rather in depth understanding of how the parts attach to one another.  It might be a design flaw.  But I don't think it's going away anytime soon.  And I for one don't want it too.

As Scott Manley says, fly safe
Moving to Archive because this bug was actually caused by part clipping.
